alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 11 at 7:14PM EDT until September 11 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN MIDDLESEX COUNTY... At 714 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms that produced the excessive rains earlier have moved away. Lingering flooding continues across the region. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Edison, East Brunswick, Sayreville, Carteret, Colonia, Society Hill, Woodbridge, South Plainfield, Highland Park, and Metuchen. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 11 and 13. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 6. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 123 and 134. Flooding was observed earlier in Edison and near Sayreville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
